CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 23, 1952, p. 1, reads: "Belmar Shrine - Because of a vision which he had, Mauro Palumbo of the East End, built a shrine on the site of Belmar Gardens. Hundreds of persons are visiting the shrine to pray and seek relief for their ills... - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Woman wearing light colored pants and dark short sleeved shirt, kneeling and praying in front of shrine, with sign inscribed "this shrine was built by ...M. Palermo, S. Lombardi, B. Donatelli and others", wooden railing, and woman wearing striped dress standing on right, Homewood
